page.title: 09JOHN LEWIS GAMEKEEPER (cont)
page.content:
{ JOHN LEWIS (Part 3)
In July the young pheasants begin to fly.There is an electric fence around the pens to stop foxes from getting in,but the foxes could still catch the pheasants when they come down from their roost in the trees at dawn (4 am.).This means that the gamekeeper has to be on patrol to scare the foxes away.If a fox gets into a pen he may kill all the pheasants but eat only one.Later on in August food is put out in the woods to encourage the birds away from the pens.In September,ducks and partridges,which have been bred early in the year,are shot.To keep the birds in one area they are fed in the morning and in the evening.During October,the gamekeeper goes around the boundaries for 2-3 hours at first light each morning to drive back the..
